column2: ENGLISH
Expected Successor
This character is currently expected to succeed their superior upon their death or retirement.
Promised an Appointed Title
Refused an Appointed Title
Retracted a Promised Appointed Title
Stole My Future Appointed Title
Tried to Steal My Future Appointed Title
Nominated Me For Appointed Title
Promised a Relative an Appointed Title
Refused a Relative an Appointed Title
Retracted a Relative's Promised Appointed Title
Open Appointment Menu
Access decisions allowing you to nominate either yourself or your relatives as the Expected Successors to various Appointed titles.
Close Appointment Menu
Hide appointment nomination decisions to clear up some space on the decision list.
Stand Down as [From.GetTitle]
You consider yourself no longer fit to lead. You have decided to stand down.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.Liege.GetCOTCShortName] currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetCOTCShortName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint you as [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] successor.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.GetCOTCName]'s superior, [Root.Liege.GetCOTCShortName], currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetCOTCShortName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint [Root.GetCOTCVeryShortName] as [Root.Liege.GetCOTCVeryShortName]'s successor.
Nominate for [Root.Liege.GetTitle]

[Root.GetCOTCName]'s superior, [Root.Liege.GetCOTCShortName], currently controls an appointed office. You could approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetCOTCShortName] and suggest that [Root.Liege.Liege.GetSheHe] appoint [Root.GetCOTCVeryShortName] as [Root.Liege.GetCOTCVeryShortName]'s successor.
[This.GetCOTCName] is not already [This.Liege.GetCOTCName]'s Expected Successor.\n
You have appointed [From.GetCOTCName] to [FromFrom.GetCOTCName]'s former offices.
[From.GetCOTCShortName] has appointed [FromFrom.GetCOTCName] to several of your former offices.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [FromFrom.GetCOTCName]
RE: Appointment to Office
[From.GetCOTCName]'s departure has left critical vacancies. As previously agreed, I am appointing you to fill those vacancies.
You will prepare to approach [Root.Liege.Liege.GetCOTCShortName].
You have to decided to suggest to [appointer.GetCOTCShortName] that [event_target.appointer.GetSheHe] should appoint you as [current_holder.GetCOTCName]'s successor.
I'll just have to ask [appointer.GetHerHim].
I'll ask [appointer.GetHerHim] to do it as a favor.
Good thing [appointer.GetSheHe] owes me a favor...
will consider your suggestion.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I believe that I am the candidate best suited to succeed [current_holder.GetCOTCName], and humbly suggest that you appoint me as such in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] death or retirement.[From.GetFavorStatus]
will be pleased.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
After due consideration, I have decided to follow your suggestion, and will appoint you as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
An excellent choice.
[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has decided to appoint [self_nominee.GetCOTCName] as your successor.
[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [self_nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor.
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!

[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [self_nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor, rather than your [current_successor.GetRootRelation] [current_successor.GetFirstName].
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!
will be disappointed.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
Regretably, while your advice is appreciated, I do not believe you are qualified for the position.
Well, it was worth a try.
[self_nominee.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.self_nominee.GetHerHim] as your successor, but was refused.
[self_nominee.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.self_nominee.GetHerHim] as [current_holder.GetCOTCName]'s successor, but was refused.

[self_nominee.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.self_nominee.GetHerHim] as [current_holder.GetCOTCName]'s successor instead of your [current_successor.GetRootRelation] [current_successor.GetFirstName], but was refused.
You have to decided to recommend that your [nominee.GetRootRelation], [nominee.GetCOTCName], be appointed as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor.
And I have the authority to do so myself.
I'll just have to ask [appointer.GetCOTCShortName].
I'll ask [appointer.GetCOTCShortName] to do it as a favor.
Good thing [appointer.GetCOTCShortName] owes me a favor...

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
Given your services to both the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] and the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] family name, I have chosen to appoint you as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
Thank you, [From.GetRootRelation].
[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as your successor.
[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor.
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!

[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor, rather than your [current_successor.GetRootRelation] [current_successor.GetFirstName].
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
It has come to my attention that you are seeking a replacement for [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName] in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] eventual retirement. I believe that [nominee.GetCOTCName] would be a fine successor, and would like to formally recommend them for the post.[From.GetFavorStatus]
will be pleased.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
At the recommendation of [patron.GetCOTCName], I have chosen to appoint you as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName] in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
Thank you, [patron.GetRootRelation].
will be pleased.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
After due consideration, I have chosen to accept your recommendation. [nominee.GetCOTCShortName] will succeed [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName] in the event of [current_holder.GetHerHis] death or retirement.
Securing a future for the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] family name.
At the recommendation of [patron.GetCOTCName], [appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as your successor.

[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor. Your sources are certain that [patron.GetCOTCName] is behind this.
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!

[appointer.GetCOTCShortName] has betrayed [appointer.GetHerHis] promise to you and decided to appoint [nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor, rather than your [current_successor.GetRootRelation] [current_successor.GetFirstName]. Your sources are certain that [patron.GetCOTCName] is behind this.
Damn you, [appointer.GetCOTCVeryShortName], you gave me your word!
will be disappointed.
Your [patron.GetRootRelation] [patron.GetCOTCName] attempted to convince [appointer.GetCOTCShortName] to appoint you as [current_holder.GetCOTCShortName]'s successor, but was unsuccessful.
will be disappointed.

TO: [Root.GetCOTCName]
FROM: [From.GetCOTCName]
RE:Future appointments to office
Regretably, while your advice is appreciated, I do not believe [nominee.GetCOTCShortName] is qualified for the position.
A disappointing result.
[patron.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.nominee.GetCOTCName] as your successor, but was refused.
[patron.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCName]'s successor, but was refused.

[patron.GetCOTCName] asked [appointer.GetCOTCName] to appoint [event_target.nominee.GetCOTCName] as [current_holder.GetCOTCName]'s successor instead of your [current_successor.GetRootRelation] [current_successor.GetFirstName], but was refused.
Demand Resignation

As [From.GetTitle], you have the authority to demand [Root.GetFullName]'s resignation from [Root.GetHerHis] appointed offices. This authority cannot be used entirely freely - there is an associated cost in political capital - but as it is within your lawful authority, it will not anger of your other subordinates.
will either forfeit [This.GetHerHis] appointed titles or rebel.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [Root.Liege.GetTitle] [Root.Liege.GetFullName]
RE: Resignation
Your most recent string of failures are the end of the line. Effective immediately, you are removed from command.
All of your appointed titles will be granted to your Expected Successor.

TO: [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetFullName]
FROM: [From.GetTitle] [From.GetFullName]
RE: Resignation
I hereby acknowledge your orders and surrender command of all appointed titles.
